metadata.title: Education in Jaro
metadata.description: Interlinear text transcribed from a YouTube video.
notes: transcribed with Joshua De Leon as part of the 2014 Fieldmethods class at UCSB, instructor Marianne Mithun.

sentences.transcription: Hello, akó si Juan Lee.
sentences.translation: Hello, I’m Juan Lee.

sentences.transcription: matopic na akó subóng
sentences.translation: I’ll start the topic now
sentences.note: As if he's going to start a new topic; Of ma-, J says: “Most of the time you use it before an action verb: the process of changing the topic is itself a verb: the process of changing the

sentences.transcription: parte sa mga eskwélahan.
sentences.translation: about the schools

sentences.transcription: kon diin ka nageskwelá
sentences.translation: where you studied.

sentences.transcription: Kon anó ginatinán mo da’
sentences.translation: of what you attended there for.

sentences.transcription: ako ya ginatinán ko ya CPU.
sentences.translation: As for me, I attended CPU.

sentences.transcription: Hálin sang nurséry sa one
sentences.translation: From nursery school through first grade
sentences.note: (Referring to first grade simply as “one”)

sentences.transcription: CPU ni ya Centralian yá Si Juan
sentences.translation: This is CPU, I’m a Centralian!
sentences.note: ni ya = this is; there’s always a competition in Iloilo about which school you went to.

sentences.transcription: in and out
sentences.translation: in and out
sentences.note: Perhaps “In and out of the school”, describing how his whole education was at CPU

sentences.transcription: dirá ko na kwaa akón mga knowlédge
sentences.translation: That’s where I got all my knowledge.
sentences.note: dirá = that’s where (in this case); mga knowlédge = all my know-how, my IQ;

sentences.transcription: Know?
sentences.translation: Know?
sentences.note: Borrowing from English. “You know?” Joshua says this is a common usage. The spelling «nu» is J’s preference, using English spelling here.

sentences.transcription: sa mga maéstra ko si CPU
sentences.translation: From my teachers at CPU

sentences.transcription: áko gapasalámat gid ko sa íla
sentences.translation: As for me, I always thank them.
sentences.note: Note fronting. In this case ’ga is short for naga-. J explicitly states this! Ga ano ka? ‘what are you doing?’ is more appropriate than Naga ano ka? ‘what are you doing?’

sentences.transcription: kay kon wala’ silá
sentences.translation: and if they hadn’t been there

sentences.transcription: seguró si Juan seguró nagapungko na sa kid-
sentences.translation: Maybe Si Juan would have been sitting on the

sentences.transcription: kilíd na naga
sentences.translation: side side of the road

sentences.transcription: kapang limós
sentences.translation: begging
sentences.note: Probably from Spanish “limosna”, ‘charity’

sentences.transcription: Thank you sa inyó mga ma’am mga sir!
sentences.translation: Thank Ma’am, thank you Sir!
sentences.note: Juan is addressing all the teachers. Female teachers are addressed with Ma’am, male as sir.

sentences.transcription: arí na estudyánte nyo hu
sentences.translation: Here’s your student now!
sentences.note: He’s proud of what he’s become: “Look at me now!” sort of tone.

sentences.transcription: Si Juan Lee hu!
sentences.translation: I’m Mr Juan Lee!

sentences.transcription: kitá nyo hu Big Time na hu sa YouTube!
sentences.translation: See! He’s Big Time now on YouTube!

sentences.transcription: Hello Ma’am! Hello Sir!
sentences.translation: Hello Ma’am! Hello Sir!
sentences.note: Still addressing the teachers.

sentences.transcription: té kon indí’ ka Centralian
sentences.translation: And if you’re not a Centralian,

sentences.transcription: té basí
sentences.translation: maybe,

sentences.transcription: indí ká harelate
sentences.translation: you can’t relate
sentences.note: [I heard ha-relate, not ka-relate here, but J says no h] here ka- would be short for maka-

sentences.transcription: Pasúnudòn ko topíc ko ha
sentences.translation: I’m going to arrange my topics
sentences.note: pasunudon = put (them) in order. Not sure of semantics of pa…on

sentences.transcription: Kinder, (e)lementary, high school, college
sentences.translation: Kindergarten, elementary, high school, college
sentences.note: All of these levels are at a single school, CPU.

sentences.transcription: Okay?
sentences.translation: Okay?

sentences.transcription: Sa kindér Si Juan
sentences.translation: In Kindergarten, Mr Juan…
sentences.note: should be sang

sentences.transcription: ang slide
sentences.translation: the slide
sentences.note: ang slide makes previous IU require sang

sentences.transcription: íya gid ná’ nya
sentences.translation: it’s his and only his
sentences.note: J suggests that maybe there was an event in his Kinder years when they used the slide, and he’s emphasizing that he’s got ownership of it.

sentences.transcription: Gapangáway ko akón ya.
sentences.translation: I’m bickering.
sentences.note: J says that Juan is being defensive here.. Not sure what -pang- is.

sentences.transcription: bal-án mo sang kinder ya
sentences.translation: You know, during Kindergarten,

sentences.transcription: ti nagalecture ang maestrá, Si Juan ya
sentences.translation: While the teacher is teaching, then Mr Juan
sentences.note: ti: a conjunction of some kind. When? Then? So? here it’s “while”

sentences.transcription: Si Juan ya nagata-ngá’ sa bentána
sentences.translation: Mr Juan is staring out the window.

sentences.transcription: gináhulát huya kon sin-o tawo’ sa akon slide
sentences.translation: I was waiting to see if anyone was going to get on the slide
sentences.note: hulát = waiting for ; sin-o = who (san-o = when). Not sure what huya is doing here — perhaps ‘dares to’?

sentences.transcription: pagkaríng sang bell dalagán dayón si Juan walá’ na ya recess-recess ah
sentences.translation: When the bell rang he ran to class right away without thinking about recess.

sentences.transcription: ang recess yá karón láng na’ ya
sentences.translation: recess would come later

sentences.transcription: bastá ang slide ákon na’ nga slide
sentences.translation: but my slide is mine

sentences.transcription: e kon maslide ka da’ sa ákon slide
sentences.translation: if you slide on my slide

sentences.transcription: indí pwede na’ nya
sentences.translation: It’s not possible; that can’t be

sentences.transcription: amó man
sentences.translation: that’s how it is!

sentences.transcription: Si Juan sang Kinder ka wild Si Juan na’ ya
sentences.translation: In Kindergarten, Juan was wild.

sentences.transcription: pahigád kamo da!
sentences.translation: Get out of my way! stay on the side

sentences.transcription: sa mga classmate ko sorry lang nga gintulod ta kamo sang una sa slide bal-án mo nga
sentences.translation: To all my classmates, I'm sorry that I pushed on the slide

sentences.transcription: bal-án mo sang uná sa inyó seesaw indí ako kapungko
sentences.translation: you know once before I couldn’t sit down on your seesaw

sentences.transcription: bal-án mo sang kinder may tag-íya na’ mó
sentences.translation: You know, in kindergarden there’s an owner

sentences.transcription: ang seesaw may tagíya na
sentences.translation: The seesaw, somebody owns the seesaw

sentences.transcription: kon sin-ó mapungko sa side sang seesaw sa pihak sa walá o sa tuó
sentences.translation: Who was sitting by the seesaw  on the left or on the right?

sentences.transcription: may mga tagíya na na ya
sentences.translation: somebody already owned it

sentences.transcription: pulongkoan
sentences.translation: the place where you can sit along the edge of the seesaw
sentences.note: Uncertain about this. I think the translation is mixed up with the speaker’s commentary on usage. Perhaps it’s p<ul>ongko-an?

sentences.transcription: ang slide sa CPU
sentences.translation: the slide at CPU

sentences.transcription: sa kindér tó kamí ka slide da’
sentences.translation: there at the kindergarden, they’re the ones using the slide

sentences.transcription: tí sa ákon, color yellow blá
sentences.translation: the yellow one was mine

sentences.transcription: pagkakita mo sa kinder sang yellow akon na
sentences.translation: when you see yellow in kindergarten, it’s mine

sentences.transcription: sa elementary na man
sentences.translation: now, in elementary,

sentences.transcription: ang mádumdumán nga mga namí nga moments ko sang elementary ko
sentences.translation: I'm remembering lots of my good moments in elementary school

sentences.transcription: sang grade five
sentences.translation: in fifth grade

sentences.transcription: sang nagatan-aw kamí sang pikchay
sentences.translation: when we’re looking at the pikchay (a vegetable)

sentences.transcription: Namí na ang gardening nga course ko sang uná.
sentences.translation: My gardening course during my elementary years was good.

sentences.transcription: dumduman ko ang mga classmates ko
sentences.translation: I remember all my classmates

sentences.transcription: Nahisa sila kay ang pechay ni Juan
sentences.translation: They’re jealous because of Juan’s pechay.

sentences.transcription: ang amon nga klase namí amon pechay kay siempre may mga abono
sentences.translation: our class was good because our pechay always had a lot of fertilizer

sentences.transcription: dakó’-dakó’ amon pecháy
sentences.translation: our pechay was the biggest

sentences.transcription: pro ang pechay nila sa tupad namon ya mga arikotoy, blaw?
sentences.translation: but the pechays of (the garden) to ours were skinny, you know?

sentences.transcription: wála iyá bala kwa’a petsay namon te na inít Si Juan?
sentences.translation: So he stole our pechay and Juan got mad.
sentences.note: Here, referring to the guy who had the skinny pechays. kwa’a = take, a very strong word, as if he stole it. But he was just trying to tease Juan to take the piss.

sentences.transcription: lapakáy kamí sang pitsay e
sentences.translation: We stomped on each others’ pechay.
sentences.note: lapák = to stomp on . lapakáy = stomp on each other. hambalánay nag

sentences.transcription: nagkadto si Ma’am Melissa sa guidance nga’a batá’ mo si Juan nangáway
sentences.translation: Mrs Melissa went to the guidance counselor’s office and asked why your son Juan started a fight.
sentences.note: nang awáy = you’re the one who started the fight. nga’a = why.

sentences.transcription: Eh, si Juan ya walá’ sya comment.
sentences.translation: Eh, Juan didn’t say anything.
sentences.note: Eh and te have similar functions.

sentences.transcription: No comment!
sentences.translation: No comment!

sentences.transcription: Embarrassing moment.
sentences.translation: Embarrassing moment.

sentences.transcription: ang embarrassing moment ni Juan ísa maláng sa elementari
sentences.translation: Juan had that embarrassing moment in elementary school.
sentences.note: isá ma lang  = one and only. like ka counter but means ‘only’

sentences.transcription: nagéntra kó chess sang grade two naga-kapót ko yá pompom.
sentences.translation: In grade two I got into a chess tournament holding pompoms.
sentences.note: here kó is shortcut for akó; kapót = holding pompoms. ko yá = I myself. always two words. nagentra vs nagakapot is a nice minimal pair for “goal focus” prefixes.

sentences.transcription: Next topic.
sentences.translation: Next topic.

sentences.transcription: High school.
sentences.translation: High school.

sentences.transcription: Bal-án mo sang úna medyó dungúl ko nagapangtaklas kudá’ sang úna sa high school
sentences.translation: You know, before I was a hard-headed guy, I used to climb over the fence in high school.
sentences.note: pang = use of; taklás = climb (over a fence or gate); dungúl = hard-headed;

sentences.transcription: ang indí ko gid malipatán nga moment sang high school ang ginsipá ko ang bolá
sentences.translation: The moment that I will not forget in high school is when I kicked the ball.
sentences.note: malipatán = to forget. sipá = to kick;

sentences.transcription: Pagsípa ko sang bóla na boká’ ang kristál te’ ginkolbaán si Juan hambal ni Juan
sentences.translation: When I kicked the ball, the crystal broke and Juan was scared and Juan said

sentences.transcription: walá’ ko to akón yá walá’ ko to akón ya
sentences.translation: I’m not there I’m not there!
sentences.note: Trying to wash his hands of responsibility. Philipinos are fond of duplicating what they say.

sentences.transcription: te’ anhún mo kay damo’-damo’  kitá
sentences.translation: What can you do, lots of people saw it.
sentences.note: anhún = what can you do; it’s hopeless

sentences.transcription: Kinse silá ka bilóg nga mga classmate ko nga walá’ kitá hambalón mo walá’walá’ ko to akón
sentences.translation: fifteen of my classmates when you asked them they hadn’t seen me
sentences.note: kinse = fifteen (they stood up for him); bilóg = in  total; all together; whole

sentences.transcription: bakasyón sa guidance
sentences.translation: vacation in the guidance counselor’s office
sentences.note: guidance counselor not the same as principal

sentences.transcription: #### indí hungod Sir ah
sentences.translation: ### it’s unintentional
sentences.note: hungód = intentional

sentences.transcription: mmm… sipa’  ko ang bulá anhun mo kay nagumpók sya
sentences.translation: hmm… I kicked the ball and you know, it bounced
sentences.note: this is an excuse; he’s implying that he doesn’t know why it happened. umpók = bounce

sentences.transcription: té Juan indí na maayo nga response
sentences.translation: So Juan, that’s not a good response.
sentences.note: Something like that’s “that’s not the right answer.” The Counselor is the one everyone is afraid of because they can expel you.

sentences.transcription: té amo to ginbáyran ni Juan
sentences.translation: So that’s why Juan paid (for the broken glass)
sentences.note: báyran = paid

sentences.transcription: fast forward
sentences.translation: fast forward

sentences.transcription: mga members kabáy sang High School
sentences.translation: We are all members of the High School
sentences.note: kabáy = I pray that; I hope that. But here, emphasizes membership in a group

sentences.transcription: baw nagapangtaklás kamí ya gate
sentences.translation: oh my, we climbed over the gate
sentences.note: taklás = to get up on something, also climb over. Joshua did this: supported longhair hippie style. A Rebel without a Cause!

sentences.transcription: may fence na da’ hu
sentences.translation: there’s the fence there

sentences.transcription: baw ginapangtaklás na da’ namón ang mga fence kon kisá nagasuhót kamí da’ siempre kay
sentences.translation: Oh my, we’d climb over those fences but sometimes we’d go under because of
sentences.note: suhót = go under. When your best friend goes behind your back; that’s also “suhót” — backstabbing.

sentences.transcription: batá’ pa to kamí makaigó’ pa kamí  to ya
sentences.translation: we were kids then we were able fit
sentences.note: igó’ = to fit ; ígo = to hit; kon indí maka igó’ i-aquit! “If it doesn’t fit, you must acquit!”

sentences.transcription: ’syensya lang sorry sa mga maéstro kag maéstra
sentences.translation: I’m sorry, I’m sorry to all the teachers
sentences.note: ’syensya = short for pasyénsya

sentences.transcription: ang nagugtás sa akón siempre
sentences.translation: especially the ones that I drove crazy
sentences.note: ugtás = to drive someone crazy

sentences.transcription: baw ang grade ko sang uná sadól mo, 75, 74, 75, 73,
sentences.translation: oh my, my grades were like a hoe: 75, 74, 75, 73
sentences.note: sadól = a hoe; the joke is that the grades start with 7, because 7 is shaped like a hoe.

sentences.transcription: baw indí ko guid malipatán ang mga memories sa CPU
sentences.translation: wow, I really can’t forget my memories at CPU
sentences.note: the ma- is obligatory

sentences.transcription: daw mga irás
sentences.translation: like there were lots of itchy bugs
sentences.note: irás is an insect that causes itchiness like poison oak; Kaufmann: “A worm of the size of a centipede that causes a painful itch when brought in contact with the skin. ”

sentences.transcription: baw damo-damó irás
sentences.translation: wow, there were lots of itchy bugs
sentences.note: damo-damo = a lot

sentences.transcription: abí mo kanamí-nami maglakat kay
sentences.translation: you know, it’s very nice to walk because

sentences.transcription: green-green ang mga acacia
sentences.translation: the acacias were so green
sentences.note: CPU has lots of acacias on campus

sentences.transcription: baw daw kanamí tulokon bala kay hambál mo
sentences.translation: wow, it’s good to look at you know, because you’ll say,
sentences.note: tulokón = to look at something; to stare at something.

sentences.transcription: daw ará’ ka lang sa postcard
sentences.translation: as if you’re in a postcard

sentences.transcription: daw makíta amó ang mga acacia green-green
sentences.translation: as if you could see those acacias, so green

sentences.transcription: tapós magpungko sa idalóm
sentences.translation: then when you sit under them

sentences.transcription: walá’ ka kabaló may nagalatáy na dí’ galí hu
sentences.translation: you wouldn’t know that there’s something crawling right here already
sentences.note: galí = surprise, maybe; latáy = to crawl

sentences.transcription: pro gapánghamót kon diin ang mga irás
sentences.translation: but you can smell where the itchy bugs are
sentences.note: pro short for pero. panghamot = the smelling; hamót = small.

sentences.transcription: medyó walá’ na man gáwa
sentences.translation: as if there’s not even a trace
sentences.note: gáwa = a trace

sentences.transcription: na hadlók seguró Juan kay
sentences.translation: they must be afraid of Juan because

sentences.transcription: maákig si Juan
sentences.translation: he might get mad
sentences.note: he uses a “whipping noise”to indicate how angry he would be

sentences.transcription: daw Spider Man bala haw’
sentences.translation: like Spider Man you know

sentences.transcription: Go web! Go web!
sentences.translation: Go web! Go web!
sentences.note: Whole sentence is in English.

sentences.transcription: Pshoot! Pshoot!
sentences.translation: Pshoot! Pshoot!
sentences.note: making noises as if shooting webs form wrists like Spider Man

sentences.transcription: ang college memories ni Juan
sentences.translation: the college memories of Juan

sentences.transcription: basta makitá’ nyo lang ko sa gazebo
sentences.translation: You all will just see me in a gazebo

sentences.transcription: ára lang ko da’ ya, okay?
sentences.translation: That’s just where I am, okay?

sentences.transcription: amó lang ná college experience ko
sentences.translation: that’s  my only college experience
sentences.note: here lang = only; ‘very strong’

sentences.transcription: indí kamó mahuyá kon makitá’ nyo ko hi kamó kay mahi man na’ si Juan
sentences.translation: Don’t be shy when you all see me say ‘hi’ and Juan will say ‘hi’ back

sentences.transcription: kon kis’á ará’ ko sa gazebo, sa big field
sentences.translation: sometimes I would be in the gazebo, on the soccer field,
sentences.note: big field = he’s talking about the CPU soccer field. Also called futbolán; kis-á = rare, some of the time

sentences.transcription: nagaligid-lígid
sentences.translation: lying down

sentences.transcription: pandakóp tibákla
sentences.translation: catching grasshoppers

sentences.transcription: makitá mo ko dá’ kon kis’á
sentences.translation: you’d see me there sometimes

sentences.transcription: ibán suyá to sa CPU
sentences.translation: others are angry about CPU
sentences.note: suyá = angry, but more slangy and less strong than ákig. more like ‘grumpy’. doesn’t last long. Not sure what to is doing here, perhaps referring to the viewing audience?

sentences.transcription: té ang inyo eskwelahán may jeep?
sentences.translation: does your school have a Jeep?
sentences.note: jeep is from the GI jeep, means general public transport. it's unusual that the school has its own transport vehicle.

sentences.transcription: amón eskwelahán may Jeep amón eskwelahán nya kitá’ mo may Jaro CPU
sentences.translation: Our school has a Jeep our school you see (that it says) Jaro CPU.
sentences.note: He's claiming it has its own jeep because it says CPU. the Public utitliy vehicles that goes around Iloilo has the route on the bus.

sentences.transcription: CPU Central Philippine University
sentences.translation: CPU Central Philippine University

sentences.transcription: té eskwelahán kay
sentences.translation: there’s a school because
sentences.note: he is trying to explain why it's written on all the buses

sentences.transcription: Jaro
sentences.translation: Jaro

sentences.transcription: sugpón na dá’ ngalán sang eskwelahán may Jaro
sentences.translation: they attach the name of the School at Jaro
sentences.note: sugpón = attached to; next

sentences.transcription: anó kay walá’?
sentences.translation: is there any?
sentences.note: is there any other school like that that has its own bus

sentences.transcription: Jaro likó’ guro ambót to kon may Likó’ nga eskwelahan
sentences.translation: Maybe a Jaro-Left I don’t know, maybe there’s a school called Left

sentences.transcription: hmm, curve
sentences.translation: hmm, curve
sentences.note: derecho = straight; the passenger line from Iloilo to Jaro is called “derecho”

sentences.transcription: curve
sentences.translation: curve
sentences.note: he's talking about the route of another jjeepney without the CPUname

sentences.transcription: huo may curve man kamí rotonda
sentences.translation: yeah, we also our own curve called the rotonda
sentences.note: rotonda = bus loop; there is one at the 3rd gate. He’s joking as if there’s a complete bus system at CPU, faux-bragging

sentences.transcription: Kitá mo ID kó? ID ko na’ sa high school, first year high school
sentences.translation: Did you see my ID? That’s my ID in high school, first year of high school.
sentences.note: (Shows his high school ID  in the video)

sentences.transcription: guinpalaminate ko kay gwápo pa ko di daan.
sentences.translation: I have it laminated because I am still handsome here.
sentences.note: daan = should, but can mean ‘old’ or still; English laminate; di daan = shortcut for di nga daan. di = short for diri; refers to the picture in the id.

sentences.transcription: hásta subóng gwápo man gyápon
sentences.translation: Even until now, just like always, I’m still handsome
sentences.note: gyápon = same as always

sentences.transcription: K? Antes kamó magcomment
sentences.translation: Okay? Before you make a comment…

sentences.transcription: damó’ sa ímo comment kon balá ka lawlaw sa íya
sentences.translation: You have lots of comments that I’m no good
sentences.note: lawlaw = no good; someone who sucks; the least talented — literally apparently “slacken”, perhaps comparable to the negative connotations of Eng. slacker

sentences.transcription: indí gustó si Juan nga mag-ininawáy kamó da’ magcomment kamó nga amo ní si ang eskwelahán nyo amo ní amo ná
sentences.translation: Juan doesn’t like for you to fight in the comments about this school or that school

sentences.transcription: Peace lang kamó balá okay?  relax lang kamó da’!
sentences.translation: Peace out all you guys okay? Just relax out there!
sentences.note: He’s telling potential YouTube commenters to chill out before writing hateful comments

sentences.transcription: Hah!
sentences.translation: Got it!?

sentences.transcription: baboush!
sentences.translation: See ya!
sentences.note: Street slang for goodbye
